item.title: Ticket #602 (URI Problems) updated
item.dc:creator: matt

item.title: Ticket #602 (URI Problems) created
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description:
Solution:

Store values in DB as normally, but allow them to be overwritten by DEFINEs in wp-config.php, WPADDRESS and BLOGADDRESS. Put conditional in get_option to use these if present. Deactivate them on option page if defines present.

item.title: Ticket #601 (Logging into Admin tool does not automatically redirect) updated
item.dc:creator: tin

item.title: Ticket #601 (Logging into Admin tool does not automatically redirect) created
item.dc:creator: tin
item.description: When I enter my username and password and press login, the login page won't redirect me to the Dashboard. It stays on wp-login.php, but the page is blank.

item.title: Ticket #600 (whitespace issue in comment moderation emails) updated
item.dc:creator: Summer
item.description: This was noticed in the 12-23-2004 nightly release of 1.5a6

item.title: Changeset [2008]: Make work with https URIs
item.dc:creator: saxmatt

item.title: Ticket #600 (whitespace issue in comment moderation emails) updated
item.dc:creator: Summer

item.title: Ticket #600 (whitespace issue in comment moderation emails) created
item.dc:creator: Summer
item.description:
in the emails that get sent out asking for comment moderation, the sentence "A new comment is waiting for your approval" runs right into the URL of the post being commented on, without line break or whitespace.

change noticed after an upgrade from 1.3a2 to 1.5a6

item.title: Ticket #578 (Links cannot be edited) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
The following patch will fix the problem for an upgraded WordPress 1.22 install. If a vanilla 1.22 install works correctly, then there must be something missing from the database in an upgraded install.

--- wordpress.orig/wp-admin/link-manager.php +++ wordpress/wp-admin/link-manager.php @@ -310,7 +310,7 @@

}

$link_id = (int) $_GETlink_id?;

  • $row = $wpdb->get_row("SELECT * FROM $wpdb->links WHERE link_id = $link_id");

+ $row = $wpdb->get_row("SELECT * FROM $tablelinks WHERE link_id = $link_id");

if ($row) {

$link_url = wp_specialchars($row->link_url, 1);

item.title: Changeset [2007]: If $p evaluates to zero, ignore it.
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: If $p evaluates to zero, ignore it.

item.description: Leave htaccess alone if permalinks are not turned on. Bug 597.

item.title: Ticket #598 (theme-editor.php should pick up the Template Name from non-standard ...) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan

item.title: Ticket #599 (Editor does not leave special characters in ascii) updated
item.dc:creator: Jenn99

item.title: Ticket #599 (Editor does not leave special characters in ascii) created
item.dc:creator: Jenn99
item.description: (This happened in 1.5-alpha-6 2004-12-22) When editing files of a theme - special characters get translated (and don't stay in ascii format) after you save. So for example, I type in © (ambersand copy semicolon) - click "Update files" - and it's no longer ascii format - it's the copyright symbol. If I click "Update files" again - then weird characters show up on my site where the copyright symbol should be...

item.title: Ticket #598 (theme-editor.php should pick up the Template Name from non-standard ...) updated
item.dc:creator: jesuit

item.title: Ticket #598 (theme-editor.php should pick up the Template Name from non-standard ...) created
item.dc:creator: jesuit
item.description: theme-editor.php should grab the Template Name of any custom templates the user throws in, so instead of the list having photosets.php, it should show Photosets Template. The information is there already it should be trivial to add it.

item.title: Ticket #597 (Get a 403 forbidden after I created or save a "page") updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger

item.title: Ticket #597 (Get a 403 forbidden after I created or save a "page") created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
After a created or save a "page". Wordpress auto created a .htaccess file under my site dir.

I try to delete it, and goto edit some page. And then WP1.5 created a .htaccess file for me again.....

I edit it to off the rewriteengine, then everything seems alright. But after a edit a "page", I got a 403 forbidden again.

# BEGIN WordPress <IfModule mod_rewrite.c> RewriteEngine On RewriteBase /wordpress/ RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} -f [OR] RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} -d RewriteRule .*$ - [S=0] </IfModule>

# END WordPress

item.title: Changeset [2005]: Load the most recent file into the template editor by default.
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: Load the most recent file into the template editor by default.
